title: Data Collection for Beginners
author: eusholli
description: This is a checklist for a beginner privacy developer when thinking about a new app, or a new feature, that will involve the gather of potentially personally identifiable information, that would be covered by data regulation.

references.title: Getting started with data protection – top tips for beginners

checklist-items.slogan: Can I reduce the data I am collecting
checklist-items.description: Data minimization is the most powerful concept in data privacy since it reduces the data ever coming into the software and data that never comes in is the easiest to work with

references.title: How to Start Implementing Data Minimization Strategies in Your Business

checklist-items.slogan: Do I have legitimate reasons for all the data you are collecting?
checklist-items.description: There has to be legitimate reasons to collect data about people, you cannot just collect any data that you want

references.title: What are the lawful bases for processing?

checklist-items.slogan: Do I capture opt-in consent before use, if needed
checklist-items.description: You must ask for the users consent to use their data before any collection and use. The consent must be opt-in, not opt-out

references.title: GDPR: When do you need to seek consent?

checklist-items.slogan: Do I record consent for all the data before collection and use?
checklist-items.description: You must have record all user consent for any PII (Personally Identifiable Information) data before use, to ensure you can easily prove consent was given

references.title: Conservative Party fined £10,000 for sending unlawful emails

checklist-items.slogan: Can the user withdraw consent as easily as it was to give?
checklist-items.description: It must be possible for the user to easily withdraw consent at any time

references.title: How should we manage the right to withdraw consent?

checklist-items.slogan: Can the customer see the data you have on them, get a report, make changes, ask for the data to be deleted?
checklist-items.description: It must be possible to provide the user with complete transparancy and control on the data you store about them

references.title: What is a Data Subject Access Request (DSAR)?
